div.p: A new CATICHISME for ever: OR, The Mite of a Miniſter.
Caſt into a Catechiſme, for the preparation of his people, before they Receive the Supper of the Lord.

q.p: Parents provoke not your Children to wrath, but bring them up in nurture and admonition of the Lord,

div.p: By Joſhuah Siſton, Miniſter at Grauby, in the Vale of Bever.
London Printed for Francis Coles, at the ſigne of the Half-bowle in the Old-Baily. 1651.

div.head: A New Catechiſme for ever. OR, The Mite of a Miniſter.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: WHat is God? and how muſt he be worſhipped?

div.p: Anſwer. John 4.24God is a Spirit, and they that worſhip him muſt worſhip him in ſpirit, and in truth.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What is the Church of God?

div.p: Anſw. Eph. 1.10 The whole company of Gods Elect, in all places and ages knit by true Faith unto Chriſt their head.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What doe you believe concerning God and his Church?

div.p: Anſw. I believe in God the Father Almighty, maker of Heaven and Earth, and in Jeſus Christ his onely Sonne our Lord, which was conceived by the Holy Ghoſt, borne of the Virgin Mary, &c.
I believe in the Holy-Ghoſt, the Holy Catholique Church, &c.
Anſw. Ro. 1.17. An apprehenſion and applicacation of Chriſt and all his Merits, as they are promiſed and offered in the word and Sacraments.
Anſw. Rom. 4.11. A Seale of the Covenant of Grace.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What is the Covenant of Grace?

div.p: Anſw. Joh. 3.16. An agreement concerning men to be freely ſaved through faith in Chriſt Jeſus.

Anſw. Mat. 18.19. A Sacrament of our Ingrafting into Chriſt, and Entrance into the Church
of God.
Anſw. It is a Sacrament of the eternall Covenant,Ioh. 6.54. whereby the ſoules of them that are ingrafted into Christ, are ſpiritually nouriſhed unto eternall life.

p.hi: Who is the Author of this Sacrament?

div.p: Anſw. The Lord Jeſus Chriſt.
Anſw. 1 Cor. 11.23. In the ſame night he was betrayed.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: Which is the ſigne that may be ſeene?

div.p: Anſw. Mat. 26.26.27. Bread and Wine.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: Which is the Grace that cannot be ſeene?

div.p: Anſw. 1 Cor. 10, 16. The Body and Blood of Chriſt.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: Who are to receive the Lords Supper?

div.p: Anſw. Such as know their miſery by ſin,Mat. 11.28. and the remedy thereof in Chriſt.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What muſt a man doe before he can become a worthy receiver?

div.p: Anſw. 1 Cor. 11, 28. He muſt examine himſelfe.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: Why muſt a man examine himſelfe?

div.p: Anſw. 1 Cor. 11.27.29. Becauſe an unworthy Receiver is guilty not onely of Chriſts Body and Blood; but he eateth and drinketh Damnation to himſelfe.
Anſw. 2 Cor. 13.5. In the Graces both of Faith and Knowledge.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What other duties are required of you?

div.p: Anſw. Repentance and Reconciliation.Mat. 5.24.
Anſw. Ionah 3.8. A true turning unto God from every evill way.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What muſt you doe after you have received?

div.p: Anſw. Prov. 4.18. I muſt endeavour to find increaſe of Faith, and all other ſaving Graces; abounding more and more in well-doing.
Anſw. Ten.
Anſw. Exod. 20.3. Thou ſhalt have none other Gods but me.

Anſw. Exod. 20.4.3.6. Thou ſhalt not make to thy ſelfe any graven Image, nor the likeneſſe of any thing that is in Heaven above, or in the Earth beneath, or in the waters under the Earth, thou ſhalt not bow down to them, nor worſhip them, for I the Lord thy God am a jealous God, viſiting the ſias of the Father upon the Children unto the third and fourth generation, of them that hate me; and ſhew mercy unto thouſands, to them that love me and keepe my Commandements.
Anſw. Exod. 20.7. Thou ſhalt not take the Name of the Lord thy God in vaine, for the Lord will not hold him guiltleſſe that taketh his Name in vaine.

Anſw. Exod. 20. v. 9.10.11. Remember thou keep'ſt holy the
Sabbath Day, ſixe dayes ſhalt thou labour and doe all that thou hast to doe; but the ſeventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou ſhalt doe no manner of worke, thou nor thy Son, nor thy Daughter, thy Man-ſervant, nor thy Maid-ſervant, thy Cattel, nor thy ſtranger that is within thy gates; for in ſixe dayes, the Lord made Heaven and Earth, and all that in them is, and reſteth the ſeventh day; therefore the Lord bleſſed the ſeventh day, and hallowed it.
Anſw. Exod. 20, 11. Honour thy Father and thy Mother, that thy dayes may be long in the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not kill.
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not commit Adultery
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not ſteale.
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not beare falſe witneſſe againſt thy Neighbour.
Anſw. Thou ſhalt not covet thy neighbours houſe, thou ſhalt not covet thy neighbours Wife, nor his Man-ſervant, nor his Maid-ſervant, nor his Oxe, nor his Aſſe nor any thing that is his.
Anſw. 1 Iohn 5.14. A calling upon God in the Name of Chriſt Jeſus, according to his will.

p.label: Queſt:
p.hi: After what manner did our Saviour teach his Diſciples to pray?

div.p: Anſw. After this manner.

p.hi: Our Father which art in Heaven,

hallowed be thy Name, thy Kingdom come, thy will be done in Earth, as it is in Heaven, give us this day our daily Bread, and forgive us our treſpaſſes as wee forgive them that treſpaſſe againſt us, and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evill, for thine is the Kingdome, the power, and thy glory, for ever and ever, Amen.
